abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Power Sector Generation
            and Restructuring Project for Albania were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was high; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the lack of
            experience in project management should be addressed at an
            early stage, providing the owner with greater support in its
            role by hiring an experienced project advisor. Although
            turnkey projects are often seen as a good way to reduce
            project risk, the Vlore project is a good example of why the
            owner must maintain a continuous presence in order to ensure
            the success of a turnkey project. In large engineering
            projects it is common practice to have a panel of experts to
            provide counsel and different points of view on solving
            problems during construction. The Vlore project was
            contracted using World Bank procurement documents. Opportune
            restructuring of a project should be performed through a
            continuous tracking of performance indicators. The Vlore
            project shows how the lack of attention to the relevance of
            indicators impacted negatively on the completion assessment
            and how this failing could have been addressed at an early stage.
